column4: I am trying to transfer our CVS program to another machine, but i am having problems with importing the passwd file. it just refuses to read it and so it only allows the user root
you'll need to change the ownership of the file
or if the program only needs to read the file run the command chmod 755 <filename>
-rwxr-xr-x   1 root Software       403 Sep 27 07:42 passwd
is the software running as the software user?
cvsd      1134  0.0  0.1   1736   480 ?        SNs  Nov16   0:00 /usr/sbin/cvsd -f /etc/cvsd/cvsd.conf
in shell, run the command whoami
well i am logged in as root
so i am root
ahh okay, is the config file pointing at the correct file? sounds like a location issue rather than permissions
CVSROOT is in /cvs/CVSROOT
on our other server i see this when ps aux | grep cvs
can you paste the exact command and error in http://www.dpaste.org/ so i cant take a look
WHich command?
the command your running to start the cvs application where you reported it wont read the password file
Thats the problem cvs is so vague, i dont even know how i started it. its not working like a normal deamon
on the orignal server can you login as root and run history? hopefully that might tell you how you initially got it started
its like 5 years old or even more, history wont help me :(
on the old/current server where cvs is running do ps -f
